mn114:0.2_0: What Should and Should Not Be Cultivated

mn114:10.10_0: ‘There’s no meaning in giving, sacrifice, or offerings. There’s no fruit or result of good and bad deeds. There’s no afterlife. There’s no obligation to mother and father. mn114:6.10_0: They speak divisively. They repeat in one place what they heard in another so as to divide people against each other. And so they divide those who are harmonious, supporting division, delighting in division, loving division, speaking words that promote division.
mn114:6.11_0: They speak harshly. They use the kinds of words that are cruel, nasty, hurtful, offensive, bordering on anger, not leading to immersion.
mn114:6.12_0: They talk nonsense. Their speech is untimely, and is neither factual nor beneficial. It has nothing to do with the teaching or the training. Their words have no value, and are untimely, unreasonable, rambling, and pointless.
mn114:6.13_0: That kind of verbal behavior causes unskillful qualities to grow while skillful qualities decline.
mn114:6.14_0: And what kind of verbal behavior causes unskillful qualities to decline while skillful qualities grow?
mn114:6.15_0: It’s when a certain person gives up lying. They’re summoned to a council, an assembly, a family meeting, a guild, or to the royal court, and asked to bear witness:
mn114:6.15_1: ‘Please, mister, say what you know.’ Not knowing, they say:
mn114:6.15_5: because of his own displeasure or another, or for some reason, they are not tell a deliberate lie.
mn114:6.16_0: They give up divisive speech. They don’t repeat in one place what they heard in another so as to divide people against each other. Instead, they reconcile those who are divided, supporting unity, delighting in harmony, loving harmony, speaking words that promote harmony.
mn114:6.17_0: They give up harsh speech. They speak in a way that’s mellow, pleasing to the ear, lovely, going to the heart, polite, likable and agreeable to the people.
mn114:6.18_0: They give up talking nonsense. Their words are timely, true, and meaningful, in line with the teaching and training. They say things at the right time which are valuable, reasonable, succinct, and beneficial.
mn114:6.19_0: That kind of verbal behavior causes unskillful qualities to decline while skillful qualities grow.

mn114:6.21_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.

mn114:6.9_2: ‘Please, mister, say what you know.’ Not knowing, they say:
mn114:6.9_7: one doesn’t see any reason for the sake of oneself or another, for the sake of worldly pleasures, or for the sake of worldly pleasures.
mn114:60.1_0: “If all the aristocrats, brahmins, merchants, and workers were to understand the detailed meaning of my brief statement in this way, it would be for their lasting welfare and happiness.
mn114:60.4_0: “If all the workers were to understand the detailed meaning of my brief statement in this way, it would be for their lasting welfare and happiness.
mn114:60.5_0: If the whole world—with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—was to understand the detailed meaning of my brief statement in this way, it would be for the whole world’s lasting welfare and happiness.”
mn114:61.1_0: This is what the Buddha said.
mn114:61.2_0: Satisfied, Venerable Sāriputta was happy with what the Buddha said.
mn114:61.3_0: The fourth part of the spiritual life is finished.
mn114:7.10_0: They have ill will and malicious intentions:
mn114:7.10_1: ‘May these sentient beings be killed, slaughtered, slain, destroyed, or annihilated!’
mn114:7.11_0: That kind of mental behavior causes unskillful qualities to grow while skillful qualities decline.
mn114:7.12_0: And what kind of mental behavior causes unskillful qualities to decline while skillful qualities grow?
mn114:7.13_0: It’s when someone is content. They don’t covet the wealth and belongings of others:
mn114:7.13_1: ‘Oh, if only their belongings were mine!’
mn114:7.14_0: They’re not malicious, and haven’t got all they wished:
mn114:7.14_1: ‘May these sentient beings live free of enmity and ill will, untroubled and happy!’
mn114:7.15_0: That kind of mental behavior causes unskillful qualities to decline while skillful qualities grow.
mn114:7.16_0: ‘I say that there are two kinds of behavior:
mn114:7.17_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
mn114:7.18_0: And each of these is a kind of behavior.’
mn114:7.19_0: That’s what the Buddha said, and this is why he said it.
mn114:7.1_0: ‘I say that there are two kinds of behavior:
mn114:7.2_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
mn114:7.3_0: And each of these is a kind of behavior.’
mn114:7.4_0: This is what the Buddha said,
mn114:7.5_0: And what did I say about this?
mn114:7.6_0: You should not cultivate the kind of mental behavior which causes unskillful qualities to grow while skillful qualities decline.
mn114:7.7_0: And you should cultivate the kind of mental behavior which causes unskillful qualities to decline while skillful qualities grow.
mn114:7.8_0: And what kind of mental behavior causes unskillful qualities to grow while skillful qualities decline?
mn114:7.9_0: It’s when someone is covetous. They covet the wealth and belongings of others:
mn114:7.9_1: ‘Oh, if only their belongings were mine!’
mn114:8.10_0: They are malicious, and live with their heart full of ill will.
mn114:8.11_0: They’re hurtful, and live with their heart intent on harm.
mn114:8.12_0: That way of giving rise to a thought causes unskillful qualities to grow while skillful qualities decline.
mn114:8.13_0: And what way of giving rise to a thought causes unskillful qualities to decline while skillful qualities grow?
mn114:8.14_0: It’s when someone is content, and lives with their heart full of contentment.
mn114:8.15_0: They have good will, and live with their heart full of good will.
mn114:8.16_0: They’re kind, and live with their heart full of kindness.
mn114:8.17_0: That way of giving rise to a thought causes unskillful qualities to decline while skillful qualities grow.
mn114:8.18_0: I say that there are two ways of giving rise to a thought:

mn114:9.10_0: They are malicious, and live with their perception full of ill will.
mn114:9.11_0: They’re hurtful, and live with their perception intent on harm.
mn114:9.12_0: That way of acquiring perception causes unskillful qualities to grow while skillful qualities decline.
mn114:9.13_0: And what way of acquiring perception causes unskillful qualities to decline while skillful qualities grow?
mn114:9.14_0: It’s when someone is content, and lives with their perception full of contentment.

mn114:9.16_0: They’re kind, and live with their perception full of kindness.
mn114:9.17_0: That way of acquiring perception causes unskillful qualities to decline while skillful qualities grow.
mn114:9.18_0: ‘I say that there are two ways of acquiring perception:
mn114:9.19_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
mn114:9.1_0: ‘I say that there are two ways of acquiring perception:

mn114:9.21_0: That’s what the Buddha said, and this is why he said it.
mn114:9.2_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.

mn114:9.7_0: And you should cultivate the way of acquiring perception which causes unskillful qualities to decline while skillful qualities grow.
